content.text:
For the purpose of this chapter, the Village of Mastic Beach
is hereby divided into use districts, which shall be designated as
follows, and such other districts as may be added by amendments to
this chapter:

Uses. In the R-1 Residence District, no building or premises shall
be used, and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, unless
otherwise provided for in this chapter, except for one or more of
the following uses:
One-family dwelling.

Churches or similar places of worship, parish houses, convents
and accessory buildings of a religious nature, when authorized by
a special permit from the Board of Trustees.

Public parks, playgrounds and recreational areas, when authorized
or operated by a governmental authority.

A regularly organized elementary or high school having a curriculum
approved by the Board of Regents of the State of New York, accredited
colleges or universities, by special permit from the Board of Trustees.
Private detached garage as an accessory building.

Other customary accessory uses and buildings, provided that
such uses are incidental to the principal use, but such uses shall
not include any activity conducted as a business.

Height. In the R-1 Residence District, no building or structure hereafter erected or altered shall exceed 30 feet or two stories, except where such building or structure lies within a Flood Damage Prevention Zone as defined in Chapter 230 of the Village Code, in which case the maximum height shall not exceed 35 feet.

Lot area. In the R-1 Residence District, no building shall be erected on a lot having an area of less than 7,500 square feet and a width of less than 75 feet at the street line and at the building line. A one-family dwelling may be built upon a lot held in single and separate ownership at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter so long as it conforms with the requirements under Article VIII, § 530-8-3, of this chapter. A one-family dwelling legally existing at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter may be altered in compliance with Article VIII, § 530-8-3, of this chapter.

Front yard. In the R-1 Residence District, no building hereafter
erected or altered shall have a depth of front yard less than 30 feet.
If on the same side of the street 40% or more of the total street
line distance between the two nearest intersecting street lines shall
have been improved with two or more buildings, or in the event that
building permits shall have been issued therefor, not less than the
average depth of yard as so established by such existing or permitted
buildings shall be maintained; provided, however, that any such front
yard depth shall not be required to be more than 40 feet.
Corner lot. In the R-1 Residence District, such lot shall have a front yard along each street and one rear yard as is provided in Subsection H.
Double-front lots. In the R-1 Residence District, the required front yard as required in Subsection D shall be provided on both street fronts.

Side yards. In the R-1 Residence District, there shall be two side
yards, one on each side of the building. The total of the widths of
both side yards shall be not less than 30 feet wide, and neither side
yard shall be less than 15 feet wide.

Rear yard. In the R-1 Residence District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 25 feet.

Building area. In the R-1 Residence District, the total building
area shall not exceed 35% of the required lot area.
Accessory buildings or structures.

Accessory buildings in the R-1 District may occupy not more
than 25% of the required rear yard.

The yard area occupied by such accessory building shall be included
in computing the percentage of lot area permitted to be built upon.

Any accessory building shall be located on the same lots with
the principal building.

No accessory building shall be constructed upon a lot or plot
until the construction of the principal structure has been actually
commenced.

No accessory building shall be used unless the principal structure
on a lot or plot has been completed and is in use.

No accessory building shall be built within two feet of any
side or rear lot line.

Maximum height of any accessory building or shed, excluding
a garage, shall not exceed 12 feet. Maximum height of a garage may
not exceed 14 feet. All accessory buildings are required to have a
pitched roof. The minimum pitch for the roof is to be 2 1/2 inches
of height for every foot of length. Highest point of the roof must
be at least 25% of the length or width of the structure inward from
at least two outer walls.

No accessory building shall exceed 144 square feet, with the
exception of a garage. No garage shall exceed 750 square feet.

No accessory building shall be built forward of the front line
of the principal structure.

No accessory building shall be built in any part of the front
yard of a property.

No accessory building shall be built within five feet of the
principal structure.
No garage shall be built within 10 feet of any yard lot lines.

No more than three accessory buildings shall be permitted on
any lot. The accessory buildings on any lot shall not consist of more
than one garage and two other accessory buildings.

No swimming pool shall be built forward of the front line of
the principal structure.

No swimming pool shall be built within 10 feet of any yard lot
lines.

Any type of structure or constructed, delivered, or erected object
not defined within this section shall not be constructed, delivered,
or erected without permission and definition by the Zoning Board of
Appeals.

Permitted encroachments. In the R-1 Residence District, the following
encroachments upon required yard areas are permitted:

Cornices, eaves, gutters, chimneys or bay windows projecting
not more than 24 inches.

One-story open covered (roofed-over) porches and terraces, projecting
not more than six feet into a required rear, front or side yard.

A one-story enclosed vestibule not greater than six feet wide
and five feet deep into a front yard.

In any case where the Zoning Board of Appeals has diminished
a required yard by a variance, none of the foregoing encroachments
shall be permitted into such diminished yard.
No more than one dwelling shall be erected on any building lot.

Accessory apartments are permitted upon the issuance of a special
permit by the Board of Trustees with restrictions on occupancy to
be determined by the Board of Trustees.

Uses. In the R-2 Residence District, no building or premises shall
be used, and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, unless
otherwise provided for in this chapter, except for one or more of
the following uses:
One-family dwelling.

Churches or similar places of worship, parish houses, convents
and accessory buildings of a religious nature, when authorized by
a special permit from the Board of Trustees.

Public parks, playgrounds and recreational areas, when authorized
or operated by a governmental authority.

A regularly organized elementary or high school having a curriculum
approved by the Board of Regents of the State of New York, accredited
colleges or universities, by special permit of the Board of Trustees.

Height. In the R-2 Residence District, no residential building or structure hereafter erected or altered shall exceed 35 feet or two stories, except where such building or structure lies within a Flood Damage Prevention Zone as defined in Chapter 230 of the Village Code, in which case the maximum height shall not exceed 40 feet.

Lot area. In the R-2 Residence District, no building shall be erected or altered on a lot having an area of less than 80,000 square feet and a width of less than 150 feet at the street line and at the building line. A one-family dwelling may be built upon a lot held in single and separate ownership at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter so long as it conforms with the requirements under Article VIII, § 530-8-3, of this chapter. A one-family dwelling legally existing at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter may be altered in compliance with Article VIII, § 530-8-3 of this chapter.

Front yard. In the R-2 Residence District, no building hereafter
erected or altered shall have a depth of front yard less than 60 feet.
If on the same side of the street 40% or more of the total street
line distance between the two nearest intersecting street lines shall
have been improved with two or more buildings, or in the event that
building permits shall have been issued therefor, not less than the
average depth of yard as so established by such existing or permitted
buildings shall be maintained; provided, however, that any such front
yard depth shall not be required to be more than 60 feet.
Corner lot. In the R-2 Residence District, such lot shall have a front yard along each street as provided in Subsection D and one rear yard as is provided in Subsection H.
Double-front lots. In the R-2 Residence District, the required front yard as required in Subsection D shall be provided on both street fronts.

Side yards. In the R-2 Residence District, there shall be two side
yards, one on each side of the building. The total of the widths of
both side yards shall be not less than 80 feet wide, and neither side
yard shall be less than 30 feet wide.

Rear yard. In the R-2 Residence District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 75 feet.

Building area. In the R-2 Residence District, the total building
area shall not exceed 15% of the lot area.
Accessory buildings or structures.

Accessory buildings in the R-2 District may occupy not more
than 15% of the required rear yard.

The yard area occupied by such accessory building shall be included
in computing the percentage of lot area permitted to be built upon.

Any accessory building shall be located on the same lots with
the principal building.

No accessory building shall be constructed upon a lot or plot
until the construction of the principal structure has been actually
commenced.

No accessory building shall be used unless the principal structure
on a lot or plot has been completed and is in use.

No accessory building shall be built within five feet of any
side or rear lot line.

No accessory structure shall exceed 750 square feet without
approval of the Zoning Board of Appeals.

Maximum height of any accessory building or shed, excluding
a garage, shall not exceed 12 feet. Maximum height of a garage may
not exceed 14 feet. All accessory buildings are required to have a
pitched roof. The minimum pitch for the roof is to be 2 1/2 inches
of height for every foot of length. Highest point of the roof must
be at least 25% of the length or width of the structure inward from
at least two outer walls.

No accessory building shall exceed 144 square feet with the
exception of a garage. No garage shall exceed 750 square feet.

No accessory building shall be built forward of the front line
of the principal structure.

No accessory building shall be built in any part of the front
yard of that property.

No accessory building shall be built within 10 feet of the principal
structure.
No garage shall be built within 15 feet of any yard lot lines.

No more than three accessory buildings shall be permitted on
any lot. The accessory buildings on any lot shall not consist of more
than one garage and two other accessory buildings.

No swimming pool shall be built forward of the front line of
the principal structure.

No swimming pool shall be built within 10 feet of any yard lot
lines.

Any type of structure or constructed, delivered, or erected object
not defined within this section shall not be constructed, delivered,
or erected without permission and definition by the Zoning Board of
Appeals.

Permitted encroachments. In the R-2 Residence District, the following
encroachments upon required yard areas are permitted:

Cornices, eaves, gutters, chimneys or bay windows projecting
not more than 24 inches.

One-story open covered (roofed over) porches and terraces, projecting
not more than six feet into a required rear, front or side yard.

One-story enclosed vestibule not greater than six feet wide
and five feet deep into front yard.

In any case where the Zoning Board of Appeals has diminished
a required yard by a variance, none of the foregoing encroachments
shall be permitted into such diminished yard.
No more than one dwelling shall be erected on any building lot.

Accessory apartments are permitted upon the issuance of a special
permit by the Board of Trustees with restrictions on occupancy to
be determined by the Board of Trustees.

Legislative intent. These provisions are intended to provide for
proper housing for the Village's senior citizens. The Board of
Trustees recognizes an existing and growing need for the provision
of housing especially designed for senior citizens. Therefore, maximum
permitted densities may be increased to accomplish these goals.

Definitions. As used in this section, the following term shall have
the meaning indicated:

Permitted uses. In the RH District, no building, structure or premises
shall be used or occupied and no building or part thereof of other
structure shall be so erected or altered except for attached or semiattached
one-family residences.

Accessory uses: customary accessory uses, structures and buildings,
provided such uses are clearly accessory and incidental to the principal
use and do not include any activity commonly conducted as a business.
Prohibited uses. All uses not expressly permitted are prohibited.
Minimum lot area. The required minimum lot area shall be eight acres.

Minimum width of lot throughout. The required minimum lot width shall
be 200 feet.

Minimum front yard setback. The required minimum front yard setback
shall be 25 feet. The Planning Board may increase the minimum required
front yard setback up to 75 feet as deemed appropriate based upon
the nature and character of development that is in close proximity
to the subject parcel. No parking shall be permitted within a designated
front yard setback.
Minimum required side yard and rear yard setbacks.

A minimum setback of 50 feet shall be provided adjacent to all
adjoining properties.

The Planning Board may decrease the minimum required side yard
or rear yard setback within a designated primary zone to 25 feet if
deemed appropriate based upon the nature and character of development
within 500 feet of the subject parcel.
Maximum permitted height.

Except as otherwise provided herein, the maximum permitted height
for all structures shall be 35 feet or 2 1/2 stories.

The Planning Board may increase the maximum permitted height
within a designated primary zone to 50 feet and/or three stories,
whichever is less.

Maximum permitted floor area ratio (FAR). The maximum permitted FAR
shall be 30%.

Density (units per acre). The maximum permitted density shall be
four units per acre.

Recreational facilities. The owner or developer of a multiple-residence
development shall set aside an area for outdoor recreational purposes
exclusively for the use of the occupants of such multiple-residence
development and their guests. Such recreational area shall be equal
to the number of units multiplied by 200 square feet for each dwelling
unit. Such area shall be shown as part of the site plan. The recreational
area may include play lot facilities and equipment, group game areas
or swimming pools. Such area shall be improved, constructed and maintained
at the expense of the owner or owners thereof. Landscaped areas which
are not developed for recreational purposes shall not be deemed to
satisfy the requirements of this section.
Time limitations on construction.

A building permit shall be secured and construction begun in
accordance with the approved final site development plan within three
years from the effective date of the Board of Trustees establishing
such zone. Application may be made to the Board of Trustees for not
more than a one-year extension of the time limit for commencement
of construction. The application shall be in the form of a written
request setting forth the basis for the request. In the event construction
is not commenced within the specified time limits, the Board of Trustees
may review the zoning classification and the construction progress
in connection therewith and, if deemed necessary, initiate proceedings
to reclassify the property as deemed appropriate.

All construction authorized in the final development plan must
be completed within two years of the date construction is commenced.
Application may be made to the Board of Trustees for not more than
a one-year extension of the time limit for completion of construction.
The application shall be in the form of a written request setting
forth the basis for the request. A plan for stated development, which
will require more time than the limits contained herein, may be approved
by the Board of Trustees prior to or during the course of construction.
In the event that construction is not completed within the time limit
specified by the Board of Trustees on this section, the Board of Trustees
may review the zoning and the progress in connection with the development
and, if necessary, initiate proceedings to reclassify the property
as deemed appropriate.

General severability. If any clause, sentence, paragraph, section
or item of this article shall be adjudged by any court of competent
jurisdiction to be invalid, such judgment shall not impair nor invalidate
the remainder hereof, but such adjudication shall be confined to its
operation to the clause, sentence, paragraph, section or item directly
involved in the controversy in which such judgment shall have been
rendered.

Uses. In the R/B District, no building or premises shall be used
and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered unless otherwise
provided in this chapter. Permitted uses shall not include and such
nonpermissible uses shall not be limited to beauty parlors, barbershops,
convalescent homes, funeral homes, dancing schools, music schools,
real estate offices, veterinarian offices, animal hospitals and biological
or medical testing laboratories. The following are permissible uses
in the R/B District:

Any principal and accessory use permitted in the R-1 Residence
District.

Offices and professional spaces as an accessory use by the owner
of the residence where the principal use is as a residence and when
authorized by the Planning Board by virtue of application thereto
as hereinafter provided.

Home-based business as an accessory use by the owner of the
residence where the principal use is as a residence and when authorized
by the Planning Board by virtue of application thereto as hereinafter
provided.

Bed-and-breakfast as an accessory use by the owner of the residence
where the principal use is as a residence and when authorized by the
Planning Board by virtue of application thereto as hereinafter provided.
Section 530-8-10 of this chapter defines the term "bed-and-breakfast"[1] and provides further regulations for their operation.

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor's Note: See the definition of "bed-and-breakfast"
in § 530-2-2, Definitions, and related provisions in § 530-8-10,
bed-and-breakfast establishments.

content.text:
Height. In the R/B District, height restrictions shall be the same
as in the R-1 Residence District.

Lot area. In the R/B District, no building shall be erected or altered on a lot having an area of less than 10,000 square feet and a width of less than 100 feet at the street line and at the building line. A one-family dwelling may be built upon a lot held in single and separate ownership at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter so long as it conforms with the requirements under Article VIII, § 530-8-3, of this chapter. A one-family dwelling legally existing at the effective date of the original amendment of this chapter may be altered in compliance with this chapter.

Front yard. In the R/B District, no building hereafter erected or
altered shall have a depth of front yard less than 30 feet. If on
the same side of the street 40% or more of the total street-line distance
between the two nearest intersecting street lines shall have been
improved with two or more buildings, or in the event that building
permits shall have been issued therefor, not less than the average
depth of front yard as so established by such existing or permitted
buildings shall be maintained; provided, however, that any such front
yard depth shall not be required to be more than 40 feet.
Corner lot. In the R/B District, such lot shall have a front yard along each street as is provided in Subsection D and one rear yard as is provided in Subsection H.
Double-front lots. In the R/B Residence District, the required front yard as required in Subsection D shall be provided on both street fronts.

Side yards. In the R/B District, there shall be two side yards, one
on each side of the building. The total of the widths of both side
yards shall be not less than 30 feet, and neither side yard shall
be less than 15 feet wide.

Rear yard. In the R/B District, the rear yard requirements shall
be not less than 25 feet.

Building area. In the R/B District, the total building area shall
not exceed 35% of the total required lot area.

Accessory buildings. In the R/B District, the restrictions on and
requirements for accessory buildings shall be the same as in the R-1
Residence District.

Parking. In the R/B Business District, off-street parking shall be required to obtain a building permit provided pursuant to the provisions of Article IX, § 530-9-1, inclusive of this chapter, except that the parking provided shall not be located in the front yard of the premises for which it is provided. This regulation limiting the required off-street parking to the rear yard may be varied by the Planning Board after application to it and a public hearing. The Planning Board, in granting a variance to the provisions of this subdivision, shall determine whether the proposed variance will be in harmony with the existing traffic and parking conditions and will adversely affect the safety, welfare and convenience of the public and whether there are practical difficulties in the way of strictly carrying out this regulation.

Permitted encroachments. In the R/B District, the permitted encroachments
shall be the same as are permitted in the R-1 Residence District.

Architectural design and other criteria for variances and special
use permits in the R/B District as approved by the Planning Board.

In the R/B District, the architectural design, scale and mass
of buildings and other structures, including, among other elements,
the exterior building material, color, roofline and building elevations,
shall be of such character as to harmonize and be compatible with
the neighborhood so as to protect property values in the neighborhood
and to preserve and improve the appearance and beauty of the community.
New construction shall adhere to the purposes of this district, in
whole or in part.

Buildings shall be designed to achieve a small-scale and residential
appearance.
Pitched-roofed buildings shall be required.

Rooftop mechanical equipment shall be prohibited, except for
energy conservation systems such as solar energy panels.

Buildings shall be designed and located on the site so as to
retain the existing topography and natural features of the land to
the greatest extent possible.

Role of Planning Board. In order to carry out the purposes of
this section, the Planning Board shall be empowered to serve as the
general administrative and review agency with the specific powers
and duties enumerated elsewhere in this subsection. The Planning Board
shall make the necessary studies, research investigations and consultations;
prepare the necessary maps, reports and other material; and undertake
such other assignments as it deems appropriate and as may be requested
by the Board of Trustees, all directed toward the preservation of
the appearance and beauty of the community.

Powers and duties of the Planning Board. In carrying out the
purposes of this subsection, the Planning Board shall have the following
powers and duties:

To review all applications for building permits,
special use permits, sign permits and variances in the R/B District
to determine what effect their granting may have on the special character
to be preserved.

To utilize the service of special consultants to
assist in the resolution of specific problems.

To consult with and offer suggestions to property
owners, residents and tenants in the R/B District to help implement
the objectives of this subsection.
Review procedure.

Applications for building permits, special use
permits, sign permits and variances within the R/B District shall
be referred to the Planning Board by the Building Inspector or the
Board of Appeals.

The Planning Board shall then review the applications
and plans in accordance with the provisions of this subsection. In
making its review, the Planning Board may confer with the applicant
or its authorized representative and shall, in making its determination,
consider the following:

The compatibility of the proposed building, structure,
alteration thereof or use of the property with neighboring properties
and the R/B District as a whole.

The visual and locational relationship between
the property in question and the R/B District's existing buildings,
structures, special character and general appearance in regard to
style, material, scale, proportion, composition, mass, line, color,
detail, setback, landscaping and related items.

Any other factors relating to aesthetic considerations
which are deemed pertinent to the benefit of the R/B District.

The number of professionals and staff on the premises,
the type of profession and hours of operation, the anticipated number
of clients at any one time on the premises, and the effect on traffic
congestion, adequate parking and pedestrian safety in the immediate
area.

By specific request in a particular case, the Planning
Board may require the submission of such plans, reports, maps, exhibits,
photographs or drawings as are necessary for its determinations. These
submissions shall include but not be limited to site plans; architectural
plans; landscaping plans; proposed signs; proposed door, window and
facade design details and colors; and photographs or drawings indicating
visual relationships to adjoining buildings and spaces in the R/B
District.

After its review and examination of the items submitted
and subsequent to such further deliberations as it deems necessary,
but within 45 days of the receipt of the application and accompanying
items for review, unless the time period is extended as mutually agreed
upon by the Planning Board and the applicant, the Planning Board shall
issue a favorable recommendation to the Building Inspector or Chairman
of the Board of Appeals only if it finds that the proposal or a modification
thereof is in fact appropriate to the character, appearance and efficient
functioning of the R/B District. When the recommendation is for denial,
the Planning Board shall state the reasons given for such recommendation.

In the R/B District, no permit shall be issued
to erect or alter a building, structure or sign in such manner as
to change the outside dimensions or exterior appearance unless and
until a recommendation has been received by the Planning Board. Likewise,
no special use permit or variance shall be granted by the Board of
Appeals until a recommendation by the Planning Board has been received.

Maintenance. Nothing contained in this subsection shall be construed
to prevent the ordinary maintenance and repair of any exterior architectural
feature or premises in the R/B District which does not involve a change
in design, material, color or the outward appearance thereof.

Uses. In the B-1 Business District, no building or premises shall
be used and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, unless
otherwise provided in this chapter, except for one or more of the
following permitted uses:
Offices and professional buildings.

Shops and stores for wholesale and retail of consumer merchandise
and services.

Personal service shops, such as barbershops, beauty parlors
and like services.
Bowling alleys.
Banks.
Undertaking establishments.

Game rooms, when allowed by special permit of the Zoning Board
of Appeals. Said permits shall commence January 1 of one year and
shall expire on December 31 of the following year unless renewed upon
timely application.
Veterinarian.

Billiard parlors, when authorized by special permit from the
Zoning Board of Appeals.

Restaurants, when authorized by special permit from the Zoning
Board of Appeals and licensed by the Suffolk County Department of
Health Services.

Bars and taverns, when authorized by special permit from the
Zoning Board of Appeals and licensed by the Suffolk County Department
of Health Services.

Grocery stores, or any other retail store that sells prepared
or packaged food products, when authorized by special permit from
the Zoning Board of Appeals and licensed by the Suffolk County Department
of Health Services.

Height. In the B-1 Business District, no building or structure hereafter erected or altered shall exceed 2 1/2 stories or 35 feet, except where such building or structure lies within a Flood Damage Prevention Zone as defined in Chapter 230 of the Village Code, in which case the maximum height shall not exceed 40 feet.

Lot area. In the B-1 Business District, no building shall be erected
or altered on a lot having an area less than 10,000 square feet and
upon a lot having a frontage of less than 80 feet.

Front yard. In the B-1 Business District, the required front yard
depth shall be not less than five feet. If 40% or more of the distance
of the street frontage on the same side of the street between the
two nearest intersecting streets shall have been improved with two
or more buildings, or in the event that building permits shall have
been issued therefor, not less than the average front yard depth as
so established by such existing or permitted buildings shall be maintained;
provided, however, that any such front yard depth shall not be required
to be more than 10 feet.

Double-front or corner lots. In the B-1 Business District, the required
front yard shall be provided for on both streets.

Rear yard. In the B-1 Business District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 15 feet.

Building area. In the B-1 Business District, the total building area
shall not exceed 75% of the total required lot area.

Accessory buildings. In the B-1 Business District, accessory buildings
may occupy 50% of the required rear yard, up to an average height
of 14 feet.

Parking. In the B-1 Business District, off-street parking shall be required to obtain a building permit provided pursuant to the provisions of Article IX, § 530-9-1, inclusive of this chapter, except that the parking provided shall not be located in the front yard of the premises for which it is provided. This regulation limiting the required off-street parking to the rear yard may be varied by the Planning Board after application to it and a public hearing. The Planning Board, in granting a variance to the provisions of this subdivision, shall determine whether the proposed variance will be in harmony with the existing traffic and parking conditions and will adversely affect the safety, welfare and convenience of the public and whether there are practical difficulties in the way of strictly carrying out this regulation.

Uses. In the B-2 Business District, no building or premises shall
be used and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, unless
otherwise provided in this chapter, except for one or more of the
following uses:
Any use permitted in the B-1 Business District.

Nightclubs or cabarets when allowed as a special exception by
the Zoning Board of Appeals.

Golf courses; private, country and yacht clubs when permitted
as a special exception by the Zoning Board of Appeals.

Shops and stores for wholesale and retail consumer merchandise
and services.

Laundromats, when allowed as a special exception by the Zoning
Board of Appeals as hereinafter provided.

Hotels, motels, and boardinghouses as a special exception by
the Board of Trustees.

Catering facilities; restaurant businesses with seating in excess
of 99 persons.
Schools: private, public, parochial, business and professional.

Minor garages and motor vehicle salesrooms as permanent buildings,
and used car lots, together with automobile service facilities other
than body shops accessory to same, when permitted as a special exception
by the Zoning Board of Appeals.
Health facilities:

Health-related facilities, including diagnostic or treatment
centers.
Outpatient care facilities.
Clinics.
After-care treatment facilities.
Psychiatric and public health centers.
Formula and/or franchise food establishments.

Legislative intent and findings. It is hereby found and established
that the Village of Mastic Beach has a strong interest in creating
and maintaining a desirable living, working and business environment
for all visitors and residents of the Village. It is further found
that the addition of formula and/or franchise food establishments,
if not monitored and regulated, will frustrate the Village's
goal of achieving a unique and diverse retail business and food establishment
base, comprised of a mix of businesses, both local and national in
nature, and that the unregulated establishment of formula or franchise
food establishments will unduly limit or eliminate business establishment
opportunities for local and small- or medium-sized businesses. In
light of the foregoing considerations, the Village has determined
that the welfare of the Village's residential, business and tourist
community will be best served and advanced by monitoring and regulating
the establishment of formula and/or franchise food establishments
through the mechanism of special use permits.

Prohibition. Formula or franchise food establishments, as defined in Article II, § 530-2-2, of this chapter, are prohibited in the B-2 Business District, except by special use permit of the Board of Trustees.

Other uses which, in the opinion of the Zoning Board of Appeals, meet the standards set forth in Subsection A of this chapter[1] and are of the same general characterization as those
listed as permitted uses in this district.

Outdoor storage when approved by the Zoning Board of Appeals
and when kept behind a six-foot-high opaque fence with an eight-foot-wide
landscaped buffer zone.

Grocery stores, or any other retail store that sells prepared
or packaged food products, when authorized by special permit from
the Zoning Board of Appeals and licensed by the Suffolk County Department
of Health Services.

Height. In the B-2 Business District, the height restrictions shall
be the same as in the B-1 Business District.

Lot area. In the B-2 Business District, no building shall be erected
or altered on a lot having an area less than 20,000 square feet and
upon a lot having a frontage of less than 100 feet.

Front yard. In the B-2 Business District, the required front yard
depth shall be not less than 25 feet. If 40% or more of the distance
of the street frontage on the same side of the street between the
two nearest intersecting streets shall have been improved with two
or more buildings, or in the event that building permits shall have
been issued therefor, not less than the average front yard depth as
so established by such existing or permitted buildings shall be maintained;
provided, however, that any such front yard depth shall not be required
to be more than 40 feet.

Double-front or corner lots. In the B-2 Business District, the required
front yard shall be provided for on both streets.

Rear yard. In the B-2 Business District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 30 feet.

Building area. In the B-2 Business District, the total building area
shall not exceed 35% of the total required lot area.

Accessory buildings. In the B-2 Business District, the restrictions
on accessory buildings shall be the same as in the B-1 Business District.

Accessory outside storage facilities: outdoor storage of motor vehicles,
trailers, motor homes stored in a fenced yard with an eight-foot-wide
landscaped buffer between the fence and the property lines after approval
by the Zoning Board of Appeals.

Parking. In the B-2 Business District, off-street parking shall be required to obtain a building permit provided pursuant to the provisions of Article IX, § 530-9-1, inclusive of this chapter, except that the parking provided shall not be located in the front yard of the premises for which it is provided. This regulation limiting the required off-street parking to the rear yard may be varied by the Planning Board after application to it and a public hearing. The Planning Board, in granting a variance to the provisions of this subdivision, shall determine whether the proposed variance will be in harmony with the existing traffic and parking conditions and will adversely affect the safety, welfare and convenience of the public and whether there are practical difficulties in the way of strictly carrying out this regulation.

Uses. In the X Business District, no building or premises shall be
used, and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, except
for use as an adult establishment or tattoo establishment. Adult and
tattoo establishments shall not be permitted in any other use district
of the Village of Mastic Beach. The X Business District is a floating
zone subject to approval by the Board of Trustees in each case and
in accordance with an approved preliminary development concept plan,
as described and defined herein.

Restrictions and requirements. In the X Business District, the restrictions
and requirements as to height, lot area, double-front lot, building
area and accessory buildings shall be the same as in the B-2 Business
District.

Front yard. In the X Business District, the required front yard depth
shall be not less than 25 feet.

Rear yard. In the X Business District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 25 feet.

An X Business District may only be established within the boundaries
of the B-2 Business District and must be 800 feet or more from any
lot line of property on which any of the following zones or uses has
been established by permit or otherwise recognized as a legally established
zone or use: community center; child-care center; school, elementary
or secondary; public park; one-family dwelling; churches, places of
worship, parish houses, convents, and accessory building of a religious
nature; R-1 Residence District; R-2 Residence District; and the R/B
District.

Site improvements. In addition to the requirements for site plan
approval by the Planning Board as set forth in this chapter, the following
site improvements shall be set forth on a site plan submitted to and
approved by the Board of Trustees, and such site improvements shall
at all times be maintained:

A brick, stone or architectural stone wall or split-cedar stockade-type
fence six feet in height shall be required along each property line,
together with such screening as may be deemed necessary by the Planning
Board or the Board of Trustees.

All exterior lighting shall be shielded so that the source of
light is not visible from any point off the property.

The plot shall be provided with curbs, and there shall be no
more than one curb cut on any road frontage.

Planting strips containing evergreen shrubs or hedges shall
be installed on each lot line.

No flashing, intermittent or revolving signs or flags, pennants
and banners shall be permitted, and no sign shall be erected without
prior approval of the dimensions and lettering of said sign by the
Board of Trustees. No signs shall contain any material other than
block lettering, which shall have been so approved.

Application procedure. The procedure for zone change and development
approval of any proposed X Business District (or the extension or
expansion of an existing X Business District) shall involve a two-stage
review process, as follows:

Approval of a preliminary development concept plan and the reclassification
of a specific parcel or parcels of land for development in accordance
with that plan by the Board of Trustees after holding a public hearing
on the application pursuant to the same notice and procedural requirements
that are generally prescribed by law for Village zoning amendments;
and

Approval of a final detailed site development plan, and a subdivision
plat, if applicable, by the Board of Trustees.

Uses. In the I Industrial District, no building or premises shall
be used and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, unless
otherwise provided in this chapter, except for one or more of the
following uses:

Automobile repair shop and automobile service stations, as shall
be restricted as follows:
No major repair work shall be permitted in the open.

Pumps, lubricating and other devices shall be located at least
25 feet from the line of any street or highway right-of-way.

All fuel, oil or similar substances shall be stored at least
35 feet distant from any street or lot line.

No motor vehicles, automobile parts, dismantled vehicles and
similar articles shall be stored in the open.

Where abutting property is zoned or used for residential purposes,
a brick, stone or architectural stone wall or split-cedar stockade-type
fence six feet in height shall be required along such property line,
together with such other screening as may be deemed necessary by the
Planning Board.

Overnight outdoor parking of any vehicle shall only be permitted
within a fenced and landscaped area not within the front yard.

No debris, junk, empty cans or garbage shall be permitted to
remain outdoors.

Gasoline, diesel fuel and/or other motor fuel may be dispensed
on a self-service basis on the condition that at least one full-service
island be opened and staffed during the hours of operation. Fuel from
said full-service island during the hours of operation shall be dispensed
only by an employee of the public garage or filling station. Automatic
fire-suppression systems approved by the Fire Inspector shall be provided
and maintained in working order over any self-service island containing
one or more such self-service pumps, and all other applicable local,
county and state laws, rules and regulations shall be adhered to.
These provisions shall apply not only to public garages and filling
stations in I Industrial Districts but to all public garages and filling
stations which may exist by nonconforming use.

Motor vehicle washing businesses or structures, except those
that are incidental or accessory to a public garage or filling station.

The sale, distribution or dispensing of any goods, wares, merchandise
or services to persons while said persons are in automobiles or other
motor vehicles.
Mini storage facility.

Height. In the I Industrial District, no building or structure hereafter
erected or altered shall exceed 2 1/2 stories or 35 feet.

Lot area. In the I Industrial District, no building or structure
shall be erected or altered on a lot having an area less than 20,000
square feet and upon a lot having a frontage of less than 100 feet.

Front yard. In the I Industrial District, the required front yard
depth shall be not less than 30 feet for any building or accessory
structure.

Double-front or corner lots. In the I Industrial District, the required
front yard shall be provided for on both streets.

Rear yard. In the I Industrial District, there shall be a rear yard
having a minimum depth of 30 feet.

Side yard. In the I Industrial District, there shall be a side yard
having a minimum depth of 25 feet.

Building area. In the I Industrial District, the total building area
shall not exceed 35% of the total required lot area.

Accessory buildings. In the I Industrial District, the restrictions
on accessory buildings shall be the same as in the B-1 Business District.

Parking. In the I Industrial District, off-street parking shall be required to obtain a building permit provided pursuant to the provisions of Article IX, § 530-9-1, inclusive of this chapter, except that the parking provided shall not be located in the front yard of the premises for which it is provided. This regulation limiting the required off-street parking to the rear yard may be varied by the Planning Board after application to it and a public hearing. The Planning Board, in granting a variance to the provisions of this subsection, shall determine whether the proposed variance will be in harmony with the existing traffic and parking conditions and will adversely affect the safety, welfare and convenience of the public and whether there are practical difficulties in the way of strictly carrying out this regulation.

Uses. It is intended, in the creation of this zoning district, that
lands which have a direct relationship to or impact upon the waterfront
areas within the Village of Mastic Beach shall be developed to enhance
the waterfront's recreational, historic, scenic, cultural, residential
and commercial values and to preserve and enhance these values for
the future. It is further intended that development in this district
encourage design features and views that best capture the relationship
between waterfront and inland that create opportunities for pedestrian
access to and along the waterfront. It is further intended that water-dependent
activities (such as marinas or bait and tackle shops) and water-enhanced
activities are not preempted by non-water-related activities. Therefore,
in the WD Waterfront District, no building or premises shall be used,
and no building shall be hereafter erected or altered, except for
one or more of the following permitted uses:

Restaurants other than drive-through restaurants when located
within 100 feet of the waterfront.

Bed-and-breakfast establishments when located within 250 feet
of the waterfront.
Marinas, commercial boathouses, boat basins and boat repair yards that are incidental to other permitted uses set forth under this Subsection A.
Facilities for sightseeing, excursion, party and fishing boats.
Membership boating and yacht clubs.

Shops, stores and other facilities for the sale of goods and
services at wholesale and/or retail, when located within 250 feet
of the waterfront and when allowed as a special exception by the Planning
Board. The goods or services must be related to or enhanced by the
waterfront location. Such activities include, but are not limited
to, the sale of fish and fish products, the sale of marine and boating
products and tourist-related shops and activities.

Other customary accessory uses and buildings, provided that
such uses are incidental to the principal use, and including but not
limited to the following:
Swimming pools, tennis courts and similar recreational facilities.
Outdoor storage of boats.
Fully enclosed and screened storage areas.

Boat storage in boat racks with a maximum structure height of
20 feet, measured from grade, consisting of no more than two tiers,
when approved by the Planning Board.
Lot regulations.

Height. No such building or structure hereafter erected or altered shall exceed 35 feet or two stories, except where such building or structure lies within a Flood Damage Prevention Zone as defined in Chapter 230 of the Village Code, in which case the maximum height shall not exceed 40 feet.

Lot area. No building shall be erected or altered on a lot having
an area less than 10,000 square feet and a width of less than 80 feet
at the street line and at the building line.

Front yard. No such building hereafter erected or altered shall
have a depth of front yard less than 30 feet.
Corner lots. Each such lot shall have a front yard along each street as is provided in Subsection B(3) and one rear yard as is provided in Subsection B(7).

Double-front lots. The required front yard shall be provided
on both streets.

Side yards. There shall be two side yards, one on each side
of the building. The total of the widths of both side yards shall
be not less than 20 feet, and neither side yard shall be less than
10 feet.

Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard having a minimum depth
of 25 feet.

Building area. The total building area shall not exceed 40%
of the required lot area.

Parking. In WD Waterfront District, off-street parking shall be required to obtain a building permit provided pursuant to the provisions of Article IX, § 530-9-1, inclusive of this chapter, except that the parking provided shall not be located in the front yard of the premises for which it is provided. This regulation limiting the required off-street parking to the rear yard may be varied by the Planning Board after application to it and a public hearing. The Planning Board, in granting a variance to the provisions of this subdivision, shall determine whether the proposed variance will be in harmony with the existing traffic and parking conditions and will adversely affect the safety, welfare and convenience of the public and whether there are practical difficulties in the way of strictly carrying out this regulation.

The boundaries of said districts are hereby established as shown
upon the Building Zone Map of the Village of Mastic Beach, Suffolk
County, New York, which map is hereby made a part of this chapter,
and all notations, references and other things shown thereon shall
be as much a part of this chapter as if fully described herein.[1]

content.footnote:
[1]
Editor's Note: The Official Zoning Map is on file in
the office of the Village Clerk. A copy of the Zoning Map is included
as an attachment to this chapter.

content.text:
No building shall be erected, altered or used and no premises
shall be used for any other purpose than as may be permitted in the
district in which such building or premises is or shall be located.

The boundaries between districts are either the center line
of streets or of railroad rights-of-way or such lines extended or
lines parallel thereto, unless otherwise indicated upon the Building
Zone Map. Where figures are shown on the Building Zone Map between
a street and a district boundary line, such figures indicate that
the district boundary line runs parallel to the street line at the
distance so indicated by such figures. When the location of a district
boundary line is not otherwise determined, it shall be determined
by the scale of the map. Whenever the lines of any existing or mapped
street vary from the same street lines as shown on the Building Zone
Map, the district designation shown on the Building Zone Map shall
govern and control.

paras.title: Division of lot by district boundary line.

content.text:
Where a district boundary line divides a lot which was held
in single and separate ownership at the date of the adoption of this
chapter, the Zoning Board of Appeals, as hereinafter provided, may
permit the less restricted use to extend to the whole or any part
of such lot for a distance not exceeding 50 feet.

When the tidal lands are not shown as zoned on the Zoning Map,
they shall be considered to lie within the R-2 Residence Zone.
